title: John Stones explains furious dressing down from Pep Guardiola after Man City beat Atalanta
text:
Pep Guardiola was livid with John Stones during Manchester City’s win over Atalanta (Picture: BT Sport)

John Stones has given his side of the story after Pep Guardiola gave him a dressing down during Manchester City’s 5-1 victory over Atalanta in the Champions League.

Raheem Sterling scored an incredible 11-minute hat-trick following Sergio Aguero’s first-half double as City maintained their 100 per cent record in Group C in convincing fashion.

A 28th-minute penalty from Ruslan Malinovskiy, Phil Foden’s sending off and an injury to Rodri were the only blemishes on an otherwise dream night for the Premier League champions at the Etihad.

Rodri went down with a suspected hamstring problem just before half-time and Guardiola called for Stones to come on in his place at centre-back alongside Fernandinho.

Rodri was forced off in the 40th minute with a suspected hamstring injury (Picture: Getty)

However, Stones was not completely ready for the substitution and took a few moments adjusting his shin pads which provoked a furious reaction from Guardiola who slammed a seat in anger.

Asked about his telling off, Stones told BT Sport: ‘I had them on but I just needed to fix them up properly.

‘Time is of the essence and that’s what he wanted.’

Guardiola will be waiting nervously for updates on Rodri’s injury after using the midfielder as a makeshift central defender in recent matches.

‘Hopefully it will be 10 days if [his hamstring] is not broken,’ Guardiola said.

‘If it is broken it will be three weeks or one month.

‘I didn’t speak with Rodri or the doctor just yet but looks like a hamstring. ‘When one guy runs and puts their hand in the hamstring position, it is a hamstring. It looks like.’
